text: Histology. Half of the tissues (brain, lung, uterus/ovary, and spleen) from each experiment were preserved in 4% (vol/vol) phosphate-buffered paraformaldehyde. Fixed tissues were embedded in paraffin, sectioned at 5 Âµm, and stained with hematoxylin-eosin (HE) for the examination of histological changes by light microscopy. The pathologist was blinded to each group.
